comment: She doesn't accept late assignments. I handed the final exam (10-15 page paper) 50 minutes late and she would not accept it. It was 45% of the final grade and I wasted over $2000 and a full semester of time because she would not accept my paper. This is graduate school; she needs to learn how to be flexible.

She was a great professor. She made things extremely interesting and I almost always went home talking about the stuff I learned to my friends. She wasn't too hard. Just make sure you pay attention in class and read and you'll do fine. I would definitely recommend her.

She is a great teacher for this class. Turn things in on time and read/skim the chapters and you will do fine. Her powerpoints are straight forward and she sends them to you via email and that is what her tests are based on. EASY and she makes it interesting with in class activities.

She does not keep attendance and does not use Web Ct (which is good since WebCt often freezes or does not function well). There were only like 4 paper assignments that are basically in the text book. Her exams often have a bonus section and when we covered the sexology part we got free condoms

Great prof! - really interesting class and easy to get an A if you study and do the homework. Doesn't take attendence, sends all the class notes via email, 5 random quizes + tests and very few homework assignments. very adament about not accepting ANY late work AT ALL, so turn stuff in on time and you'll be fine. I'd definitely take her again!
READ AND STUDY THE BOOK DO THE HOMEWORK AND YOU WILL MAKE AN EASY A+

I liked her. I enjoyed going to class and she was pretty funny. Midterm, Final, and 5 HW assignments. Random quizzes to see if you read the chapter, but normally only if people don't discuss during class. Gives study guides for midterm and final that are VERY similar to the tests which is awesome. I would take her again!

She doesn't take attendance but if you don't show for a test, turn in homework, or you're not there when she returns papers.. she'll count that as an absence. The tests were extremely easy since she gives you a study guide with basically all the material. The homework assignments, which are given in advance, are easy and only 2 questions each.

opionated professor, but hilarious. Helpful to read before coming to class and to prepare for tests, but she gives a study guide that is pretty much exactly what's on the test so you can just memorize that information. two tests, midterm and final. no big essays, just 5 homework essays which are not difficult at all. overall, great prof.

Terri Wilder was without a doubt the worst teacher I have every had.  I'm not sure if she was distracted because she was also a student at the time or if she is just that bad.  She was unorganized and provided no uselful feed back to her students.  She used the class to push her own agenda. One test a final.  Would not recomend at all.

I felt like I was in a Gay Rights and AIDS Awareness Class; these are important topics, but not all there is to Sociology. She an interesting teacher to say the least. One big final,one big research paper,and a couple assignments about the readings from the chapters make up your grade. She conducts her class very loosely so it is easy to get behind

I really enjoyed this class, which means something because i'm a business major. Although at times it was a little unprofessional, who cares??? we're in college and i think she's still a student, professionalism can wait...great class, learned a lot, she's flexible too which was helpful when i had a non-school related conflict with my final
EASY A!! the class was boring, but as long as u came to class every time, u received 10 points at the end. the only grades pretty much is the really easy final and a paper&powerpoint.

The class consists of only two grades, a term paper, and a final.  The paper is only 6 pages. Final has a study guide which is pretty close to the real deal. Attendance is not mandatory, but I highly suggest you go to class.  She gives you up to 10 points on your final grade in the end of the semester if you show up everyday.

The class was fairly easy. We had a report on a social issue of our choice which was interesting. Class is boring, all we did was group activities. She almost never went over the material in the book. The final was not hard, but it was cumulative. Overall, an easy class as long as you don't mind going everyday to be bored.
Nice person but class got rather boring due to constant repetition of information. Did the same things every week final was long but not hard as long as you know the information.
